sub_topic: The Mandelbrot set and its fractal properties
message_1: What is the value of the area of the main cardioid in the Mandelbrot set? express your answer rounded to the nearest hundredth.
message_2:
The area of the main cardioid in the Mandelbrot set can be calculated using the formula:

Area = (1/2) * π * (1 - 1/4)^2

Area ≈ (1/2) * π * (3/4)^2

Area ≈ (1/2) * π * (9/16)

Area ≈ (9/32) * π

Area ≈ 0.88357 * π

Area ≈ 2.775

So, the area of the main cardioid in the Mandelbrot set is approximately 2.78 (rounded to the nearest hundredth).
